work.name: Mercedes-Benz AG, Autonomous Driving R&D Team
work.summary:
• I have worked on my thesis on topic of Consistency-aware Video Generation: Dynamic, Semantic, and Geometric Constraints for Improved Temporal Coherence. In the thesis, I enhance temporal consistency of video generation (VG) in an end-to-end multimodal manner. I propose a novel framework for fine-tuning pretrained VG models (specifically Stable Video Diffusion), while keeping the inference control-free. The framework enforces dynamic, semantic, and depth consistency using a set of losses. These losses compare outputs of off-the-shelf object detection (DN-DETR), feature extraction (DINO), and depth estimation models between ground-truth and generated videos. For this work, I have designed distributed training and evaluation pipelines deployed on GCP with Flyte, using support of accelerate library. 
 • Additionally, I have contributed to a scientific publication accepted to the IEEE IV 2026 conference, based on this thesis, conducting all the experiments and contributing to the manuscript preparation.

work.name: Mercedes-Benz AG, Autonomous Driving R&D Team
work.summary:
• During this research-driven internship, I have researched the fields of diﬀusion-based video generative and world models (WM) and conditioning mechanisms (ControlNet). This research contributed to a master’s thesis proposal. 
 • I have experiments with models: Stable Video Diffusion (SVD), Vista WM, Cosmos WM and Ctrl-V (SVD with ControlNet). 
 • Used infrastructure: Google’s cloud computing service (GCP) with Flyte and Weights&Biases support. I have developed a tutorial on GCP and workflow setup for GCP, now used by the team. 
 • Participated and presented my work in team research sync meetings.
